head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #42

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #42 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Clear cool weather, wind from the Eastward[.]
Cloudy cold strong SE wind, with light snow men employed cutting Fire Wood, Jonas & Lamotte excepted who are still at the Head […]
Strong Westwardly winds & drift cloudy weather at times, men employed as usual in woods[.]
Mild weather, but cloudy – wind from the Westward men employed cutting fire wood, Jonas fini[sh]es in the woods[.]

Cloudy weather with high winds from the NW Jonas & Lamotte at the head rails – Paquet since yesterday is at work with Mr Logan men the others as usual at fire wood – I finish a locker in the Nancys cabbin[.]
Clear weather & cold Eastwardly winds, men employed as usual, cutting fire wood & at the Nancys head rails – Lamotte gets 2 more knees for the head[.]

Clear mild weather, fore part of the day light airs from the SE, in the afternoon wind chops round to the N.W. & blows fresh, Jacob is laid up from a tree falling on him the others are still employed in the woods, Jonas at the Head rails, Lamotte at the windlass freshening the whelping – took 4 – 10 ft 2 In: plank for the windlass – this day may said to be the first of Spring[.]
Clear fine weather, westwardly winds – & thaws considerably.
Clear pleasant weather wind this day from the SE – McGregor, & Morrison on cutting fire wood, Paquet assisting Mr Logans men squaring, Jonas at the Head – Myself & Lamotte Whelping the Windlass[.]

Clear pleasant weather wind at SE thaws much this day – McGregor until noon was with the black smith – repairing head Irons made 4 Staples – the others employed as usual Jacob making sinnet not well enough to go to the woods self & Lamotte finish the windlass, place the hooks on the Shutters McGregor, Morrison & Paquet finish in the woods[.]

Dull weather & light showers of rain, at times, all hands go to the mink, but our efforts are vainless carry away a single block belonging to the P[…] H[…] stranded a ps of new rope in 2 places, carry away a tackle pull & single block, at noon return with part of the Nancys geer afternoon Lamotte with the smith Jonas at the rack, McGregor & Morrison at over hauling the geer which was up at the mink Jacob & Paquet making sinette[.]
29th Recd 4 loads of fire wood of the Nancys mens cutting, but haul'd by Mr Logans Sleighs[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
